Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2012 11:38PM - edited Apr 7, 2012 11:41PM by AnewBeginning Hi Chrissera Im sorry you have to be here with us but you have found the place where you will get much support and some here are so knowledgeable about B/C.  I only know from my own experience.........Had a mammo=suspicious for malignance and was sent for a stereotactic biopsy which concluded I had DCIS.  Lumpectomy and Radio Frequency Ablation, outpatient and was not a big deal.  Biopsy was done after the lumpectomy and my dx changed from DCIS to IDC meaning there was a small area of micro-invasion.  That hasnt changed anything for me as I am ER&PR-.  I am just being monitored closely with followup MRI's and Sono's.  A few weeks ago I had my 1 year Mammo and report stated Bi-rads of 5, highly suggestive of malignancy.  When my doctor got my report he immediately wanted to see the film and when he did he told me he wasnt 100% convinced it was cancer again.  I had a U/S wire guided biopsy and got my results on Wednesday and thank God it was all benign.   My thoughts and prayers are with you.........all the best!  It does get easier once you have a plan of action with your doctors. hugs
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed and Confused chrissera Butterflylady2012

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2011 03:55AM AnewBeginning wrote: I too was dx with DCIS 3cm and was told by two BS's that there was no rush for my lumpectomy.  I was dx in Jan 3 2011 and my BS told me there was no rush so I scheduled a 2nd opinion and was told the same by second surgeon.  My surgery was on 2/17 and biopsy found a area of micro-invasion.  Im wondering but will never know if I had the surgery right away if it would have been contained in the milk duct.  My previous mammo was in Feb of 2010 and there was no sign of DCIS so it was only a matter of 10 months for me.  Noone can tell you how to decide but if I could do it over again, I would have scheduled the surgery immediately aft Dx.  Best of luck to you hugs to ya! AJ
Posts.Title: AM I REALLY THAT STUPID?? NEED LOTS OF ADVICE! rn4babies rn4babies

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2011 05:15PM AnewBeginning wrote: I have had a fibroadenmoa for almost 20 years that has been being watched.  It doesnt show on mammo's......I have been getting sono's every 6 months for so many years and some years back I was all set for surgery and when they were trying to locate it on Sono screen so they could put a wire in for the surgeon to see the spot it was in they could not locate it.  I was sent home and its just been being watched every 6 months.  for the past few years it shows up when it feels like it.... sometimes yes and sometimes no.  When I had my lumpectomy on 2/17/11 it was also nowhere to be found.........go figure. Point is ........my GYN wanted it out.  He believed if you weren't born with it you should have it removed.  Hope this helps

Posts.Content: May 15, 2015 01:10AM AnewBeginning wrote: Hi all I havent posted for awhile but I have been trying to read from time to time. I want to say Im happy for those of us who have been doing well with tx's and sorry for those who have had a rough ride. We have to hang in there because the chemo is BIGGER than the beast and we will all get through this. I have to say my 3 rounds were much easier than I expected and Im hoping #4 will be the same. My MO told me my next tx of THP will even be better with no nausea and Im looking forward to that because the nausea is the worst thing for me making it hard for me to hydrate because liquids make the nausea worse for me. I've tried every drink on the shelf and just find one worse than the other and also because my tastebuds are not working good. Uggggg! I was even able to drive myself yesterday and that was great was very tired that night but woke up next morning feeling feeling great and full of energy and spent the day doing yardwork. My sister who is in from California does not drive in NYC but the company was great. She will be leaving next tuesday and I must say I will miss her terrible as she has been so supportive.and great company. My next tx plan is THP but will be weekly. I know se's are different for all of us but would like to get some feedback as to what your different experiences are. Good vibes to those of you who are heading to the chemo bar today.....  (((hugs)))

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2015 10:31AM AnewBeginning wrote: Hi all Had my first chemo Wednesday April 15. It didn't start our great I wound up being there 9 hours in total. Started out with seeing MO first at 10a then for blood which showed my platelets to be 79 and was told they could not do chemo unless it was 101. Ok so they had me sit and about 1 hr later they said they were going to redo the bloodwork. They did and now it came back being 101 and they would now do the chemo. I didnt know much about platelets but I didnt think it was something that could change so rapidly so and I wanted to be sure my platelets were up so I asked for copies of both tests. They explained that the first test may have had clumped platelets together. So my chemo didnt start until 4pm and lasted 3 hours. The access to my port was easy and the tx went smooth. So far s/e are just about a little tired or weak and a bit of shortness of breath but nothing to complain about. No nausea to speak of but am taking the compazine. Appetite is good so far. I got to take my Neulasta shot Thursday and am taking Claritin ...so far no pain but I dont know when that would start if ever. So far Im ok and I hope to stay this way..........fingers crossed here. (((hugs)))
Posts.Title: April 2015 Chemo Crew... Starting in April? Please join us! KBeee KBeee

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2015 07:08AM AnewBeginning wrote: Mysunshine4 I dont think anyone here was as scared as me as I was thinking about not even doing the chemo but the wonderful ladies helped give me the strength and courage to go ahead. So far today I feel better than I did on this day than I did last tx. Good luck and think positive!! (((hugs))))

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2015 07:37AM AnewBeginning wrote: Ladies I havent been able to post much but want to say my 1st tx with AC on Apr 15 was not as bad as I expected. I did get very fatigues for about 6 days and on day 8 or 9 I did get some bone pain from the Neulasta injection and headache but nothing I couldnt handle. Appetite was great and even gained 2 pounds. My biggest problem is hydrating myself. I hate water!!! I've tried cutting some juices and gatorade but still am not drinking enough. I will find something, thing is I'm never thirsty........ So today being day 2 I feel better than I did day two last 1st tx, hope it continues this way as I want to go pick up my wig today. I had a synthetic one but hate it so decided to get a human and Im hoping I will be thrilled with it. Will let you know. To all the ladies going for tx's good luck to you all and just "think positive"  (((hugs)))

Posts.Content: May 1, 2015 06:04AM AnewBeginning wrote: lovlilynne The bone pain was in in lower back and spine and also in my toes. It was like pulsating (stabbing) but not excruciating pain. I bought a carry case for my meds and put a few of each to carry around for reasons you are experiencing, get one it will come in handy.  (((hugs)))

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2015 09:44PM AnewBeginning wrote: Mamajen Seems like our s/e are all so different. My nausea seemed to be under control with the meds cause I didnt have much or any nausea. I had my Neulasta shot 24 hours later and didnt get bone pain but did take the Claritin day of and for and thru Sunday. Much tiredness and fatigue which is to be expected and slept on and off for the first few days. One sleepless night because I didnt take the Ativan but took it the next night and again was up every hour on the hour. Today in late afternoon Im feeling a bit more energetic, mind you "a bit" but I hope it continues. I am forcing myself to drink flavored seltzer (hate water) as I hate water so this is hard for me. So far my appetitie is really good and I hope it continues to be because I cannot afford to lose 1 lb. Im glad we are here for one another and pray for all of us to get thru this as easy as possible. (((hugs)))

Going for #11 today then 1 more to go. My original MO's plan was after Taxol it would be Herceptin and Perjeta every 3 weeks for 39 weeks which comes to 13 Perjeta. I changed my hospital and now have a new MO and her plan is to give me only 6 Perjeta saying there is no data that Perjeta has any benefit beyond the 6. Should I be concerned? Any and all feedback appreciated.

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2015 07:18AM AnewBeginning wrote: Special K I have to say I'm learning more from you and the wonderful ladies here than I have learned from my facility. Trying to drink water to get my body used to it but I have to run to the bathroom every half hour so how will I be able to ever get out of the house? I cant get past 4 12 oz bottles and Im told that is not enough. Posts.Title: Despite everything... this is scary! kieraann Blessings2011

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2012 07:50AM - edited Apr 4, 2012 10:29PM by AnewBeginning Lottie do make an appt with you doc again and if he dismisses it please find another doctor.  Yes it may be a fibroadenoma or just a cyst but its best to get it checked as soon as possible.  I have to disagree with Kieraann as to the pain.  When I developed my breast cancer I did have pain and was pretty relieved thinking that b/c was painless as most believe.  To my surprise I was dx with B/C. Since then I have read many more woman did also have pain.  Im hoping you get negative result but stay on top of it. hugs to ya!

Wig started out longer than my hair but they cut it so close to my style so I think I will be ok with it. I wasted money ordering 2 online and I hate them. My hairdresser cut them but I wasnt happy. I will keep one for an emergency but hope I wont have to wear it. I still have my hair so I will go back for a head shave and they will adjust the fit. Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2012 08:48PM AnewBeginning wrote: Chrissera there is not much I can add to this because the women here have said just about all.....only thing I would like to say is have faith and no matter what the outcome you will be able to handle it.........we are all afraid of the unknown but if and I say IF it turns out to be the dreaded disease your doctors will lay out a plan for you.  I was scared to death and made myself sick until that time.  Now I take it one day at a time and just try to find the strength to get through each day.  Best of luck and dont be afraid of the biopsy.......thats really not a big deal at all.  Been through a few in my life. Hugs to ya! Ang

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2012 10:32AM AnewBeginning wrote: Hi Strongone21 Im so sorry you have to find yourself here but you will have lots of support and valuable information from the many woman (and men) who have been there.  Your mom is lucky to have a daughter like you being so concerned and I commend you for that.  I think Melrose summed it up for you and I do think a second opinion would give you more peace of mind.  Hearing the dx is the worst part of it all but once your Moms doctors have a plan in place for her she with the support of you will get through this.  Hugs and prayers to you and your Mom. hugs
